arabicText: أَسْبَـٰبَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ فَأَطَّلِعَ إِلَىٰٓ إِلَـٰهِ مُوسَىٰ وَإِنِّى لَأَظُنُّهُۥ كَـٰذِبًۭا ۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ زُيِّنَ لِفِرْعَوْنَ سُوٓءُ عَمَلِهِۦ وَصُدَّ عَنِ ٱلسَّبِيلِ ۚ وَمَا كَيْدُ فِرْعَوْنَ إِلَّا فِى تَبَابٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
“The	routes	of	the	heavens,	in	order	to	
glance	at	the	God	of	Moosa	-	and	indeed	I	
think	he	is	a	liar”;	this	is	how	the	evil	deeds	
of	Firaun	were	made	seeming	good	to	him,	
and	he	was	stopped	from	the	path;	and	the	
evil	scheme	of	Firaun	was	destined	to	be	
ruined.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kāhe	ke	rāste	āasmānoñ	ke	to	Mūsā	ke	
khudā	ko	jhāñk	kar	dekhoñ	aur	be-shak	mere	gumān	meiñ	to	woh	jhootā	hai	aur	yoñhi	Fir'aun	ki	
nigāh	meiñ	us	kā	burā	kām	bhalā	kar	dikhāyā	gayā	aur	woh	rāste	se	rokā	gayā	aur	Fir'aun	kā	dāo	
halāk	hone	hi	ko	thā.

arabicText: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِىٓ ءَامَنَ يَـٰقَوْمِ ٱتَّبِعُونِ أَهْدِكُمْ سَبِيلَ ٱلرَّشَادِ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	believer	said,	“O	my	people!	
Follow	me,	I	shall	show	you	the	way	of	righteousness.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	woh	Imān	wālā	bola	aey	meri	qaum	mere	piche	chalo	maiñ	tumheñ	bhalāyi	ki	rāh	batāoñ.

arabicText: يَـٰقَوْمِ إِنَّمَا هَـٰذِهِ ٱلْحَيَوٰةُ ٱلدُّنْيَا مَتَـٰعٌۭ وَإِنَّ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةَ هِىَ دَارُ ٱلْقَرَارِ
englishTranslationText:
“O	my	people!	The	life	of	this	world	is	just	a	brief	usage,	and	indeed	the	next	abode	is	one	of	
everlasting	stay.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	meri	qaum	yeh	duniyā	kā	jinā	to	kuchh	baratnā	hi	hai	aur	be-shak	woh	pichlā	hamesha	rahne	
kā	ghar	hai.

arabicText: مَنْ عَمِلَ سَيِّئَةًۭ فَلَا يُجْزَىٰٓ إِلَّا مِثْلَهَا ۖ وَمَنْ عَمِلَ صَـٰلِحًۭا مِّن ذَكَرٍ أَوْ أُنثَىٰ وَهُوَ مُؤْمِنٌۭ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ يَدْخُلُونَ ٱلْجَنَّةَ يُرْزَقُونَ فِيهَا بِغَيْرِ حِسَابٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
“Whoever	commits	an	evil	deed	will	not	be	repaid	except	to	the	same	extent;	and	whoever	does	
good	deeds,	whether	a	man	or	a	woman,	and	is	a	Muslim,	will	be	admitted	into	Paradise,	in	which	
they	will	receive	sustenance	without	account.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jo	burā	kām	kare	to	usey	badla	na	mile	gā	magar	utnā	hi	aur	jo	achchā	kām	kare	mard	khwāh	
áurat	aur	ho	Musalmān	to	woh	Jannat	meiñ	dākhil	kiye	jāyeñ	ge	wahāñ	be-ginti	rizq	pāyeñ	ge.

arabicText: ۞ وَيَـٰقَوْمِ مَا لِىٓ أَدْعُوكُمْ إِلَى ٱلنَّجَوٰةِ وَتَدْعُونَنِىٓ إِلَى ٱلنَّارِ
englishTranslationText:
“And	O	my	people!	What	is	the	matter	with	
me	that	I	call	you	towards	salvation	
whereas	you	call	me	towards	hell?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	aey	meri	qaum	mujhe	kyā	huā	maiñ	
tumheñ	bulātā	hoñ	najāt	ki	ṭaraf	aur	tum	
mujhe	bulāte	ho	dozakh	ki	ṭaraf.

arabicText: تَدْعُونَنِى لِأَكْفُرَ بِٱللَّهِ وَأُشْرِكَ بِهِۦ مَا لَيْسَ لِى بِهِۦ عِلْمٌۭ وَأَنَا۠ أَدْعُوكُمْ إِلَى ٱلْعَزِيزِ ٱلْغَفَّـٰرِ
englishTranslationText:
“You	call	me	to	disbelieve	in	Allah	and	
ascribe	such	as	partners	to	Him,	regarding	
whom	I	do	not	have	any	knowledge	-	
whereas	I	call	you	towards	the	Most	
Honourable,	the	Oft	Forgiving!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Mujhe	is	ṭaraf	bulāte	ho	ke	Allāh	kā	inkār	
karoñ	aur	aise	ko	us	kā	sharik	karoñ	jo	
mere	'Ilm	meiñ	nahiñ	aur	maiñ	tumheñ	us	
'Izzat	wāle	bahut	bakhsh	ne	wāle	ki	ṭaraf	
bulātā	hoñ.

arabicText: لَا جَرَمَ أَنَّمَا تَدْعُونَنِىٓ إِلَيْهِ لَيْسَ لَهُۥ دَعْوَةٌۭ فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا وَلَا فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ وَأَنَّ مَرَدَّنَآ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ وَأَنَّ ٱلْمُسْرِفِينَ هُمْ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلنَّارِ
englishTranslationText:
“So	it	is	self	evident	that	what	you	call	me	
towards	has	no	benefit	being	prayed	to,	
either	in	this	world	or	in	the	Hereafter,	and	
that	our	return	is	towards	Allah,	and	that	
the	transgressors	only	are	the	people	of	
the	fire.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Āap	hi	sābit	huā	ke	jis	ki	ṭaraf	mujhe	bulāte	
ho	usey	bulānā	kahiñ	kām	kā	nahiñ	duniyā	
meiñ	na	āakhirat	meiñ	aur	yeh	hamārā	
phirnā	Allāh	ki	ṭaraf	hai	aur	yeh	ke	ḥad	se	
guzarne	wāle	hi	dozakhi	haiñ.

arabicText: فَسَتَذْكُرُونَ مَآ أَقُولُ لَكُمْ ۚ وَأُفَوِّضُ أَمْرِىٓ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بَصِيرٌۢ بِٱلْعِبَادِ
englishTranslationText:
“And	soon	the	time	will	come	when	you	
will	remember	what	I	now	say	to	you;	and	
I	entrust	my	tasks	to	Allah;	indeed	Allah	
sees	the	bondmen.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	jald	woh	waqt	āatā	hai	ke	jo	maiñ	tum	
se	kah	rahā	hoñ	usey	yād	karo	ge	aur	maiñ	
apne	kām	Allāh	ko	sauñptā	hooñ	be-shak	
Allāh	bandoñ	ko	dekhtā	hai.

arabicText: فَوَقَىٰهُ ٱللَّهُ سَيِّـَٔاتِ مَا مَكَرُوا۟ ۖ وَحَاقَ بِـَٔالِ فِرْعَوْنَ سُوٓءُ ٱلْعَذَابِ
englishTranslationText:
Therefore	Allah	saved	him	from	the	evils	of	
their	scheming,	and	an	evil	punishment	
enveloped	the	people	of	Firaun.	-
romanUrduTranslationText: To	Allāh	ne	usey	bachā	liyā	un	ke	makr	ki	burāiyoñ	se	aur	Fir'aun	wāloñ	ko	bure	áƶāb	ne	āa	gherā.

arabicText: ٱلنَّارُ يُعْرَضُونَ عَلَيْهَا غُدُوًّۭا وَعَشِيًّۭا ۖ وَيَوْمَ تَقُومُ ٱلسَّاعَةُ أَدْخِلُوٓا۟ ءَالَ فِرْعَوْنَ أَشَدَّ ٱلْعَذَابِ
englishTranslationText:
The	fire	-	upon	which	they	are	presented	
morning	and	evening;	and	when	the	Last	
Day	is	established	-	“Put	the	people	of	
Firaun	into	the	most	severe	punishment.”	
(Punishment	in	the	grave	is	proven	by	this	verse.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Āag	jis	par	subḥ-o-sham	pesh	kiye	jāte	haiñ	aur	jis	din	qiyāmat	qāim	hogi	ḥukm	hogā	Fir'aun	
wāloñ	ko	sakht	tar	áƶāb	meiñ	dākhil	karo.

arabicText: وَإِذْ يَتَحَآجُّونَ فِى ٱلنَّارِ فَيَقُولُ ٱلضُّعَفَـٰٓؤُا۟ لِلَّذِينَ ٱسْتَكْبَرُوٓا۟ إِنَّا كُنَّا لَكُمْ تَبَعًۭا فَهَلْ أَنتُم مُّغْنُونَ عَنَّا نَصِيبًۭا مِّنَ ٱلنَّارِ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	they	will	quarrel	amongst	themselves	in	the	fire,	those	who	were	weak	will	say	to	
those	who	sought	greatness,	“We	were	your	followers,	so	will	you	reduce	from	us	some	of	the	
punishment	of	the	fire?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	woh	āag	meiñ	bāham	jhagdeñ	ge	to	kamzor	un	se	kaheñ	ge	jo	bade	bante	the	ham	tumhāre	
tābe'	the	to	kyā	ham	se	āag	kā	koyi	ḥissa	ghatā	lo	ge.

arabicText: قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱسْتَكْبَرُوٓا۟ إِنَّا كُلٌّۭ فِيهَآ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ قَدْ حَكَمَ بَيْنَ ٱلْعِبَادِ
englishTranslationText:
Those	who	were	proud	will	say,	“We	are	all	in	the	fire	-	indeed	Allah	has	already	passed	the	
judgement	among	the	bondmen.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh	takabbur	wāle	bole	ham	sab	āag	meiñ	haiñ	be-shak	Allāh	bandoñ	meiñ	faisla	farmā	chukā.

arabicText: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ فِى ٱلنَّارِ لِخَزَنَةِ جَهَنَّمَ ٱدْعُوا۟ رَبَّكُمْ يُخَفِّفْ عَنَّا يَوْمًۭا مِّنَ ٱلْعَذَابِ
englishTranslationText:
And	those	who	are	in	the	fire	said	to	its	guards,	“Pray	to	your	Lord	to	decrease	the	punishment	
upon	us	for	one	day.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jo	āag	meiñ	haiñ	us	ke	dāroghoñ	se	bole	apne	Rab	se	Du'ā	karo	ham	par	áƶāb	kā	aik	din	halkā	
kar	de.

arabicText: قَالُوٓا۟ أَوَلَمْ تَكُ تَأْتِيكُمْ رُسُلُكُم بِٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتِ ۖ قَالُوا۟ بَلَىٰ ۚ قَالُوا۟ فَٱدْعُوا۟ ۗ وَمَا دُعَـٰٓؤُا۟ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ إِلَّا فِى ضَلَـٰلٍ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	“Is	it	not	that	your	Noble	
Messengers	used	to	come	to	you	with	clear	
signs?”	They	said,	“Why	not,	surely	yes!”	
They	said,	“Then	you	yourselves	pray”;	and	
the	prayer	of	the	disbelievers	is	nothing	
but	astray.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Unhoñ	ne	kahā	kyā	tumhāre	pās	tumhāre	
Rasool	nishāniyāñ	na	lāte	the	bole	kiyuñ	
nahiñ	bole	to	tumhiñ	Du'ā	karo	aur	kāfiroñ	
ki	du'ā	nahiñ	magar	bhatakte	phirne	ko

arabicText: إِنَّا لَنَنصُرُ رُسُلَنَا وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَيَوْمَ يَقُومُ ٱلْأَشْهَـٰدُ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	We	will	surely	help	Our	Noble	
Messengers,	and	the	believers,	in	the	life	of	
this	world	and	on	the	day	when	the	
witnesses	will	be	standing.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	zaroor	Ham	apne	Rasooloñ	ki	
madad	kareñ	ge	aur	Imān	wāloñ	ki	duniyā	
ki	zindagi	meiñ	aur	jis	din	gawāh	khade	
hoñ	ge.

arabicText: يَوْمَ لَا يَنفَعُ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ مَعْذِرَتُهُمْ ۖ وَلَهُمُ ٱللَّعْنَةُ وَلَهُمْ سُوٓءُ ٱلدَّارِ
englishTranslationText:
The	day	on	which	the	unjust	will	not	gain	
any	benefit	from	their	excuses,	and	for	
them	is	the	curse,	and	for	them	is	the	
wretched	home.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jis	din	zālimoñ	ko	un	ke	bahāne	kuchh	kām	
na	deñ	ge	aur	un	ke	liye	l'anat	hai	aur	un	ke	
liye	burā	ghar.

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَا مُوسَى ٱلْهُدَىٰ وَأَوْرَثْنَا بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	We	gave	Moosa	the	guidance,	
and	bequeathed	the	Book	to	the	
Descendants	of	Israel.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	ham	ne	Mūsā	ko	rahnumāyi	
áṭā	farmāyi	aur	bani	Isrā’il	ko	Kitāb	kā	
wāris	kiyā	.

arabicText: هُدًۭى وَذِكْرَىٰ لِأُو۟لِى ٱلْأَلْبَـٰبِ
englishTranslationText:
A	guidance	and	an	advice	for	the	people	of	
intellect
romanUrduTranslationText: Áql	mandoñ	ki	hidāyat	aur	nasiḥat	ko.

arabicText: فَٱصْبِرْ إِنَّ وَعْدَ ٱللَّهِ حَقٌّۭ وَٱسْتَغْفِرْ لِذَنۢبِكَ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ بِٱلْعَشِىِّ وَٱلْإِبْكَـٰرِ
englishTranslationText:
Therefore	be	patient	(O	dear	Prophet	
Muhammad	-	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	
him),	undoubtedly	Allah’s	promise	is	true,	
and	seek	forgiveness	for	the	sins	of	your	
own	people,	and	praising	your	Lord,	proclaim	His	Purity	morning	and	evening.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	aey	Maḥboob	tum	sabr	karo	be-shak	Allāh	kā	w'ada	sachchā	hai	aur	apnoñ	ke	gunāhoñ	ki	
mu'āafi	chāho	aur	apne	rab	ki	t'arif	karte	huye	subḥ	aur	sham	us	ki	pāki	bolo.

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يُجَـٰدِلُونَ فِىٓ ءَايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ بِغَيْرِ سُلْطَـٰنٍ أَتَىٰهُمْ ۙ إِن فِى صُدُورِهِمْ إِلَّا كِبْرٌۭ مَّا هُم بِبَـٰلِغِيهِ ۚ فَٱسْتَعِذْ بِٱللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْبَصِيرُ
englishTranslationText:
Those	who	dispute	concerning	the	signs	of	Allah	without	any	proof	having	come	to	them	-	in	their	
hearts	is	nothing	but	a	craving	for	greatness	which	they	shall	never	achieve;	therefore	seek	the	
refuge	of	Allah;	indeed	He	only	is	the	All	Hearing,	the	All	Seeing.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	jo	Allāh	ki	āayatoñ	meiñ	jhagdā	karte	haiñ	be	kisi	sanad	ke	jo	unheñ	mili	ho	un	ke	diloñ	meiñ	
nahiñ	magar	aik	badāyi	ki	hawas	jise	na	pahuñcheñ	ge	to	tum	Allāh	ki	panāh	māñgo	be-shak	wohi	
suntan	dekhtā	hai.

arabicText: لَخَلْقُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ أَكْبَرُ مِنْ خَلْقِ ٱلنَّاسِ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ ٱلنَّاسِ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Certainly	the	creation	of	the	heavens	and	the	earth	is	far	greater	than	the	creation	of	men,	but	
most	people	do	not	know.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	āasmānoñ	aur	zamin	ki	paidāish	āadmiyoñ	ki	paidāish	se	bahut	badi	lekin	bahut	log	
nahiñ	jānte.

arabicText: وَمَا يَسْتَوِى ٱلْأَعْمَىٰ وَٱلْبَصِيرُ وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ وَلَا ٱلْمُسِىٓءُ ۚ قَلِيلًۭا مَّا تَتَذَكَّرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	blind	and	the	sighted	are	not	equal	-	and	neither	are	the	believers	who	perform	good	
deeds	and	the	wicked	equal;	how	very	little	do	you	ponder!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	andhā	aur	ankhiyārā	barābar	nahiñ	aur	na	woh	jo	Imān	lāye	aur	achche	kām	kiye	aur	badkār	
kitnā	kam	dhiyān	karte	ho.

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلسَّاعَةَ لَـَٔاتِيَةٌۭ لَّا رَيْبَ فِيهَا وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ ٱلنَّاسِ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	the	Last	Day	will	surely	come,	there	
is	no	doubt	in	it	-	but	most	people	do	not	
accept	faith.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	Qayāmat	zaroor	āane	wāli	hai	is	
meiñ	kuchh	shak	nahiñ	lekin	bahut	log	
Imān	nahiñ	lāte.

arabicText: وَقَالَ رَبُّكُمُ ٱدْعُونِىٓ أَسْتَجِبْ لَكُمْ ۚ إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَسْتَكْبِرُونَ عَنْ عِبَادَتِى سَيَدْخُلُونَ جَهَنَّمَ دَاخِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	your	Lord	proclaimed,	“Pray	to	Me,	I	
will	accept;	indeed	those	who	stay	
conceited	towards	worshipping	Me,	will	
enter	hell	in	disgrace."
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tumhāre	Rab	ne	farmāyā	Mujh	se	Du'ā	
karo	Maiñ	qubool	karoñ	gā	be-shak	woh	jo	
Meri	'ibādat	se	ooñche	khinchte	(takabbur	
karte)	haiñ	ánqarib	Jahannam	meiñ	jāyeñ	
ge	ƶaleel	ho	kar.

arabicText: ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلَّيْلَ لِتَسْكُنُوا۟ فِيهِ وَٱلنَّهَارَ مُبْصِرًا ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَذُو فَضْلٍ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ ٱلنَّاسِ لَا يَشْكُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
It	is	Allah	Who	created	night	for	you	so	that	
you	may	gain	rest	in	it,	and	the	day	giving	
sight;	indeed	Allah	is	Most	Munificent	
towards	mankind,	but	most	people	do	not	
give	thanks.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allāh	hai	jis	ne	tumhāre	liye	rāt	banāyi	ke	
us	meiñ	āarām	pāo	aur	din	banāyā	
āañkheñ	kholtā	be-shak	Allāh	logoñ	par	
fazl	wālā	hai	lekin	bahut	āadmin	shukr	
nahiñ	karte.

arabicText: ذَٰلِكُمُ ٱللَّهُ رَبُّكُمْ خَـٰلِقُ كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ لَّآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۖ فَأَنَّىٰ تُؤْفَكُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Such	is	Allah,	your	Lord,	the	Creator	of	all	
things;	there	is	no	God	except	Him;	so	
where	are	you	reverting?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	hai	Allāh	tumhārā	Rab	har	cheez	kā	
banane	wālā	us	ke	siwā	kisi	ki	bandagi	
nahiñ	to	kahāñ	aundhe	jāte	ho.

arabicText: كَذَٰلِكَ يُؤْفَكُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَانُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ يَجْحَدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
This	is	how	those	who	deny	the	signs	of	
Allah	go	reverting.
romanUrduTranslationText: Yuñhi	aundhe	hote	haiñ	woh	jo	Allāh	ki	Āayatoñ	kā	inkār	karte	haiñ.

arabicText: ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلْأَرْضَ قَرَارًۭا وَٱلسَّمَآءَ بِنَآءًۭ وَصَوَّرَكُمْ فَأَحْسَنَ صُوَرَكُمْ وَرَزَقَكُم مِّنَ ٱلطَّيِّبَـٰتِ ۚ ذَٰلِكُمُ ٱللَّهُ رَبُّكُمْ ۖ فَتَبَارَكَ ٱللَّهُ رَبُّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
It	is	Allah	Who	made	for	you	the	earth	your	
resting	place	and	the	sky	a	canopy,	and	
moulded	you	so	gave	you	the	best	shape,	
and	gave	you	pure	things	for	sustenance;	
such	is	Allah,	your	Lord;	so	Most	
Auspicious	is	Allah,	the	Lord	Of	The	
Creation.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allāh	hai	jis	ne	tumhāre	liye	zamin	thahrāo	banāyi	aur	āasmān	chat	aur	tumhāri	tasweer	ki	to	
tumhāri	surateñ	achchi	banāyiñ	aur	tumheñ	suthri	cheezeñ	rozi	diñ	yeh	hai	Allāh	tumhārā	Rab	
to	badi	barkat	wālā	hai	Allāh	Rab	sāre	jahān	kā.

arabicText: هُوَ ٱلْحَىُّ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ فَٱدْعُوهُ مُخْلِصِينَ لَهُ ٱلدِّينَ ۗ ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
It	is	He,	the	Alive	-	there	is	no	God	except	Him;	therefore	worship	Him	as	His	sincere	bondmen;	
all	praise	is	to	Allah,	the	Lord	Of	The	Creation.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Wohi	zinda	hai	us	ke	siwā	kisi	ki	bandagi	nahiñ	to	usey	pojo	nire	usi	ke	bande	ho	kar	sab	
khoobiyāñ	Allāh	ko	jo	sāre	jahān	kā	rab.

arabicText: ۞ قُلْ إِنِّى نُهِيتُ أَنْ أَعْبُدَ ٱلَّذِينَ تَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ لَمَّا جَآءَنِىَ ٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتُ مِن رَّبِّى وَأُمِرْتُ أَنْ أُسْلِمَ لِرَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	-	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him),	“I	have	been	forbidden	
to	worship	those	whom	you	worship	besides	Allah	whilst	clear	proofs	have	come	to	me	from	my	
Lord;	and	I	have	been	commanded	to	submit	to	the	Lord	Of	The	Creation.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāo	maiñ	maná	kiyā	gayā	huñ	ke	unheñ	poojuñ	jinheñ	tum	Allāh	ke	siwā	poojte	ho	jab	
ke	mere	pās	roshan	dalileñ	mere	Rab	ki	ṭaraf	se	āayiñ	aur	mujhe	ḥukm	huā	hai	ke	Rab-ul-Āalamin	
ke	ḥuzoor	gardan	rakhuñ.

arabicText: هُوَ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَكُم مِّن تُرَابٍۢ ثُمَّ مِن نُّطْفَةٍۢ ثُمَّ مِنْ عَلَقَةٍۢ ثُمَّ يُخْرِجُكُمْ طِفْلًۭا ثُمَّ لِتَبْلُغُوٓا۟ أَشُدَّكُمْ ثُمَّ لِتَكُونُوا۟ شُيُوخًۭا ۚ وَمِنكُم مَّن يُتَوَفَّىٰ مِن قَبْلُ ۖ وَلِتَبْلُغُوٓا۟ أَجَلًۭا مُّسَمًّۭى وَلَعَلَّكُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
It	is	He	Who	created	you	from	clay,	then	
from	a	drop	of	liquid,	then	from	a	clot	of	
blood,	and	then	brings	you	forth	as	a	child,	
then	keeps	you	alive	for	you	to	reach	
adulthood	and	then	to	become	old;	and	
some	among	you	pass	away	earlier,	and	for	
you	to	reach	an	appointed	term,	and	so	that	
you	may	understand.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Wohi	hai	Jis	ne	tumheñ	mitti	se	banāyā	
phir	pāni	ki	bond	se	phir	khoon	ki	phutak	
se	phir	tumheñ	nikāltā	hai	bachcha	phir	
tumheñ	bāqi	rakhtā	hai	ke	apni	jawāni	ko	
pahuñcho	phir	is	liye	ke	boodhe	ho	aur	tum	
meiñ	koyi	pahle	hi	uthā	liyā	jātā	hai	aur	is	
liye	ke	tum	aik	muqarrar	w'ade	tak	
pahuñcho	aur	is	liye	ke	samjho.

arabicText: هُوَ ٱلَّذِى يُحْىِۦ وَيُمِيتُ ۖ فَإِذَا قَضَىٰٓ أَمْرًۭا فَإِنَّمَا يَقُولُ لَهُۥ كُن فَيَكُونُ
englishTranslationText:
It	is	He	Who	gives	life	and	death;	so	
whenever	He	wills	a	thing,	He	only	says	to	
it	“Be”	–	it	thereupon	happens!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Wohi	hai	ke	jilātā	(zinda	kartā)	hai	aur	
mārtā	hai	phir	jab	koyi	ḥukm	farmātā	hai	
to	us	se	yahi	kahtā	hai	ke	ho	jā	jabhi	woh	
ho	jātā	hai.

arabicText: أَلَمْ تَرَ إِلَى ٱلَّذِينَ يُجَـٰدِلُونَ فِىٓ ءَايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ أَنَّىٰ يُصْرَفُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Did	you	not	see	those	who	dispute	
concerning	the	signs	of	Allah?	Where	are	
they	being	diverted?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	tum	ne	unheñ	na	dekhā	jo	Allāh	ki	
Āayatoñ	meiñ	jhagadte	haiñ	kahāñ	phere	
jāte	haiñ.

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِٱلْكِتَـٰبِ وَبِمَآ أَرْسَلْنَا بِهِۦ رُسُلَنَا ۖ فَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Those	who	denied	the	Book	and	what	We	
sent	with	Our	Noble	Messengers;	so	they	
will	soon	come	to	know.	-
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	jinhoñ	ne	jhutlāyi	kitāb	aur	jo	ham	ne	
apne	Rasooloñ	ke	sāth	bhejā	woh	án-qarib	
jān	jāyeñ	ge.

arabicText: إِذِ ٱلْأَغْلَـٰلُ فِىٓ أَعْنَـٰقِهِمْ وَٱلسَّلَـٰسِلُ يُسْحَبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
When	around	their	necks	will	be	shackles	
and	chains;	they	will	be	dragged.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jab	un	ki	gardanoñ	meiñ	ṭauq	hoñ	ge	aur	
zanjireñ	ghasite	jāyeñ	ge.

arabicText: فِى ٱلْحَمِيمِ ثُمَّ فِى ٱلنَّارِ يُسْجَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
In	boiling	water;	they	will	then	be	ignited	*	
in	the	fire.	(Like	fuel	-	see	verse	2:24)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Khaulte	pāni	meiñ	phir	āag	meiñ	dahkāye	
jāyeñ	ge.

arabicText: ثُمَّ قِيلَ لَهُمْ أَيْنَ مَا كُنتُمْ تُشْرِكُونَ
englishTranslationText:
It	will	then	be	said	to	them,	“Where	are	the	
partners	you	used	to	appoint?”	-
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	un	se	farmāyā	jāye	gā	kahāñ	gaye	woh	
jo	tum	sharik	batāte	the.

arabicText: مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ قَالُوا۟ ضَلُّوا۟ عَنَّا بَل لَّمْ نَكُن نَّدْعُوا۟ مِن قَبْلُ شَيْـًۭٔا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُضِلُّ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“As	rivals	to	Allah?”	;	they	will	say,	“We	
have	lost	them	-	in	fact	we	never	used	to	
worship	anything	before!”;	this	is	how	
Allah	sends	the	disbelievers	astray.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allāh	ke	muqābil	kaheñ	ge	woh	to	ham	se	gum	gaye	balke	ham	pahle	kuchh	poojte	hi	na	the	Allāh	
yonhi	gumrāh	kartā	hai	kāfiroñ	ko.

arabicText: ذَٰلِكُم بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَفْرَحُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ بِغَيْرِ ٱلْحَقِّ وَبِمَا كُنتُمْ تَمْرَحُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“This	is	the	recompense	of	your	being	happy	upon	falsehood	in	the	earth,	and	the	recompense	of	
your	conceit.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	us	kā	badla	hai	jo	tum	zamin	meiñ	bāṭil	par	khush	hote	the	aur	us	kā	badla	hai	jo	tum	itrāte	
the.

arabicText: ٱدْخُلُوٓا۟ أَبْوَٰبَ جَهَنَّمَ خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا ۖ فَبِئْسَ مَثْوَى ٱلْمُتَكَبِّرِينَ
englishTranslationText: “Enter	the	gates	of	hell,	to	remain	in	it	forever”;	so	what	a	wretched	destination	for	the	haughty!
romanUrduTranslationText: Jāo	Jahannam	ke	darwāzoñ	meiñ	us	meiñ	hamesha	rahne	to	kyā	hi	burā	thikānā	maghrooroñ	kā.

arabicText: فَٱصْبِرْ إِنَّ وَعْدَ ٱللَّهِ حَقٌّۭ ۚ فَإِمَّا نُرِيَنَّكَ بَعْضَ ٱلَّذِى نَعِدُهُمْ أَوْ نَتَوَفَّيَنَّكَ فَإِلَيْنَا يُرْجَعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Therefore	be	patient	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	-	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him),	undoubtedly	
Allah’s	promise	is	true;	and	whether	We	show	some	of	what	We	promise	them,	or	cause	you	to	
pass	away	before	it	-	in	any	case	they	will	return	to	Us.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	tum	sabr	karo	be-shak	Allāh	kā	w'ada	sachchā	hai	to	agar	Ham	tumheñ	dikhā	deñ	kuch	woh	
cheez	jis	kā	unheñ	w'ada	diyā	jātā	hai	yā	tumheñ	pahle	hi	wafāt	deñ	bahr-e-ḥāl	unheñ	Hamāri	hi	
ṭaraf	phirnā.

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا رُسُلًۭا مِّن قَبْلِكَ مِنْهُم مَّن قَصَصْنَا عَلَيْكَ وَمِنْهُم مَّن لَّمْ نَقْصُصْ عَلَيْكَ ۗ وَمَا كَانَ لِرَسُولٍ أَن يَأْتِىَ بِـَٔايَةٍ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ فَإِذَا جَآءَ أَمْرُ ٱللَّهِ قُضِىَ بِٱلْحَقِّ وَخَسِرَ هُنَالِكَ ٱلْمُبْطِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	We	sent	many	Noble	Messengers	
before	you,	so	We	have	related	to	you	the	
affairs	of	some	among	them,	and	not	
related	the	affairs	of	some;	and	no	Noble	
Messenger	has	the	right	to	bring	any	sign	
except	with	the	command	of	Allah;	so	the	
time	when	the	command	of	Allah	comes,	
the	true	judgement	will	be	delivered	and	
there	will	the	people	of	falsehood	be	
ruined.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	Ham	ne	tum	se	pahle	kitne	hi	
Rasool	bheje	ke	jin	meiñ	kisi	kā	aḥwāl	tum	
se	bayān	farmāyā	aur	kisi	kā	aḥwāl	na	
bayān	farmāyā	aur	kisi	Rasool	ko	nahiñ	
pahuñchtā	ke	koyi	nishāni	le	āaye	be-ḥukm	
Khudā	ke	phir	jab	Allāh	kā	ḥukm	āaye	gā	
sachchā	faisla	farmā	diyā	jāye	gā	aur	bāṭil	
wāloñ	kā	wahāñ	khasāra.

arabicText: ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلْأَنْعَـٰمَ لِتَرْكَبُوا۟ مِنْهَا وَمِنْهَا تَأْكُلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
It	is	Allah	Who	created	the	animals	for	you,	
in	order	for	you	to	ride	some	of	them,	and	
some	to	eat.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allāh	hai	jis	ne	tumhāre	liye	chaupāye	
banāye	ke	kisi	par	sawār	ho	aur	kisi	kā	
gosht	khāo.

arabicText: وَلَكُمْ فِيهَا مَنَـٰفِعُ وَلِتَبْلُغُوا۟ عَلَيْهَا حَاجَةًۭ فِى صُدُورِكُمْ وَعَلَيْهَا وَعَلَى ٱلْفُلْكِ تُحْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	in	them	are	numerous	benefits	for	
you,	and	for	you	to	reach	your	hearts’	
desires	while	riding	them	-	and	you	ride	
upon	them	and	upon	the	ships.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tumhāre	liye	un	meiñ	kitne	hi	fāyde	
haiñ	aur	is	liye	ke	tum	un	ki	pith	par	apne	
dil	ki	murādoñ	ko	pahuñcho	aur	un	par	aur	
kashtiyoñ	par	sawār	hote	ho.

arabicText: وَيُرِيكُمْ ءَايَـٰتِهِۦ فَأَىَّ ءَايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ تُنكِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	He	shows	you	His	signs;	so	which	sign	
of	Allah	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	tumheñ	apni	nishāniyāñ	dikhātā	
hai	to	Allāh	ki	kaun	si	nishāni	kā	inkār	karo	
ge.

arabicText: أَفَلَمْ يَسِيرُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ فَيَنظُرُوا۟ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَـٰقِبَةُ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ ۚ كَانُوٓا۟ أَكْثَرَ مِنْهُمْ وَأَشَدَّ قُوَّةًۭ وَءَاثَارًۭا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ فَمَآ أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يَكْسِبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Did	they	not	travel	in	the	land	to	see	what	
sort	of	fate	befell	those	before	them?	They	
were	more	than	these	in	number,	and	they	
exceeded	them	in	strength	and	the	signs	
they	left	behind	in	the	earth	-	so	what	
benefit	did	they	get	from	what	they	
earned?
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	kyā		unhoñ	ne	zamin	meiñ	safar	na	kiyā		ke	dekhte	un	se	agloñ	kā	kaisā	anjām	huā	woh	un	se	
bahut	the	aur	un	ki	quwwat	aur	zamin	meiñ	nishāniyāñ	un	se	zayāda	to	un	ke	kyā	kām	āayā	jo	
unhoñ	ne	kamāyā.

arabicText: فَلَمَّا جَآءَتْهُمْ رُسُلُهُم بِٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتِ فَرِحُوا۟ بِمَا عِندَهُم مِّنَ ٱلْعِلْمِ وَحَاقَ بِهِم مَّا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ يَسْتَهْزِءُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	when	their	Noble	Messengers	came	to	
them	with	clear	signs,	they	remained	happy	over	the	worldly	knowledge	they	possessed,	and	
upon	them	only	reverted	what	they	used	to	mock	at!
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	jab	un	ke	pās	un	ke	Rasool	roshan	dalileiñ	lāye	to	woh	usi	par	khush	rahe	ho	un	ke	pās	duniyā	
kā	'Ilm	thā	aur	unhiñ	par	ulat	padā	jis	ki	hansi	banāte	the.

arabicText: فَلَمَّا رَأَوْا۟ بَأْسَنَا قَالُوٓا۟ ءَامَنَّا بِٱللَّهِ وَحْدَهُۥ وَكَفَرْنَا بِمَا كُنَّا بِهِۦ مُشْرِكِينَ
englishTranslationText:
So	when	they	saw	Our	punishment,	they	said,	“We	accept	faith	in	the	One	Allah,	and	reject	those	
whom	we	ascribed	with	Him.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	jab	unhoñ	ne	hamārā	áƶāb	dekhā	bole	ham	aik	Allāh	par	Imān	lāye	aur	jo	us	ke	sharik	karte	
the	un	se	munkir	huye.

arabicText: فَلَمْ يَكُ يَنفَعُهُمْ إِيمَـٰنُهُمْ لَمَّا رَأَوْا۟ بَأْسَنَا ۖ سُنَّتَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلَّتِى قَدْ خَلَتْ فِى عِبَادِهِۦ ۖ وَخَسِرَ هُنَالِكَ ٱلْكَـٰفِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	their	accepting	of	faith	did	not	benefit	them	when	they	saw	Our	punishment;	the	tradition	of	
Allah	which	has	passed	among	His	bondmen;	and	there	were	the	disbelievers	ruined.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	un	ke	Imān	ne	unheñ	kām	na	diyā	jab	unhoñ	ne	hamārā	áƶāb	dekh	liyā	Allāh	kā	dastoor	jo	us	
ke	bandoñ	meiñ	guzar	chuka	aur	wahāñ	kāfir	ghāte	meiñ	rahe.

arabicText: حمٓ
englishTranslationText:
Ha-Meem*.(*Alphabets of the Arabic 
language; Allah and to whomever He 
reveals, know their precise meanings.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ha-Meem*.(* Arabi zabān ke Huroof 
jinke Ma’āni Allah aur Jis par Allah Ta’āla 
ne inko Nazil Farmaya Wahi Janta hai.)

arabicText: تَنزِيلٌۭ مِّنَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
englishTranslationText:
This	(Qur’an)	is	sent	down	from	the	Most	
Gracious,	the	Most	Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	utārā	hai	bade	Raḥam	wāle	Maherbān		
kā.

arabicText: كِتَـٰبٌۭ فُصِّلَتْ ءَايَـٰتُهُۥ قُرْءَانًا عَرَبِيًّۭا لِّقَوْمٍۢ يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
A	Book	the	verses	of	which	are	explained	
in	detail,	the	Qur’an	in	Arabic	for	people	of	
intellect.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aik	Kitāb	hai	jis	ki	Āayateñ	mufassal	
farmāyi	gayiñ	Arabi	Qurān	áql	wāloñ	ke	
liye.

arabicText: بَشِيرًۭا وَنَذِيرًۭا فَأَعْرَضَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ فَهُمْ لَا يَسْمَعُونَ
romanUrduTranslationText:
Khushkhabri	detā	aur	dar	sunātā	to	un	
meiñ	aksar	ne	muñh	pherā	to	woh	sunte	hi	
nahiñ.

arabicText: وَقَالُوا۟ قُلُوبُنَا فِىٓ أَكِنَّةٍۢ مِّمَّا تَدْعُونَآ إِلَيْهِ وَفِىٓ ءَاذَانِنَا وَقْرٌۭ وَمِنۢ بَيْنِنَا وَبَيْنِكَ حِجَابٌۭ فَٱعْمَلْ إِنَّنَا عَـٰمِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	they	say,	“Our	hearts	are	covered	
against	the	affair	you	call	us	to,	and	there	is	
deafness	in	our	ears,	and	there	is	a	barrier	
between	us	and	you	-	therefore	mind	your	
own	business,	we	are	minding	ours.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	bole	hamāre	dil	ghilāf	meiñ	haiñ	us	bāt	
se	jis	ki	ṭaraf	tum	hameñ	bulāte	ho	aur	
hamāre	kānoñ	meiñ	tent	(ruyi)	hai	aur	
hamāre	aur	tumhāre	darmiyān		rok	hai	to	
tum	apnā	kām	karo	ham	apnā	kām	karte	
haiñ.

arabicText: قُلْ إِنَّمَآ أَنَا۠ بَشَرٌۭ مِّثْلُكُمْ يُوحَىٰٓ إِلَىَّ أَنَّمَآ إِلَـٰهُكُمْ إِلَـٰهٌۭ وَٰحِدٌۭ فَٱسْتَقِيمُوٓا۟ إِلَيْهِ وَٱسْتَغْفِرُوهُ ۗ وَوَيْلٌۭ لِّلْمُشْرِكِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	-	
peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him),	
“Physically	I	am	a	human	like	you	-	I	
receive	the	divine	revelation	that	your	God	
is	only	One	God,	therefore	be	upright	
towards	Him	and	seek	forgiveness	from	
Him”;	and	woe	is	to	the	polytheists.	-
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāo	āadmi	hone	meiñ	to	maiñ	
tumhiñ	jaisā	hoñ	mujhe	waḥi	hoti	hai	ke	
tumhārā	m'abood	aik	hi	m'abood	hai	to	us	
ke	ḥuzoor	sidhe	raho	aur	us	se	mu'āfi	
māñgo	aur	kharābi	hai	shirk	wāloñ	ko.

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْتُونَ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَهُم بِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ هُمْ كَـٰفِرُونَ
englishTranslationText: Those	who	do	not	give	the	obligatory	charity,	and	who	deny	the	Hereafter.-
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh	jo	zakāt	nahiñ	dete	aur	woh	āakhirat	ke	munkir	haiñ.

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ لَهُمْ أَجْرٌ غَيْرُ مَمْنُونٍۢ
englishTranslationText: Indeed	for	those	who	believed	and	did	good	deeds,	is	a	limitless	reward.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	jo	Imān	lāye	aur	achche	kām	kiye	un	ke	liye	be	intihā	sawāb	hai.

arabicText: ۞ قُلْ أَئِنَّكُمْ لَتَكْفُرُونَ بِٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ ٱلْأَرْضَ فِى يَوْمَيْنِ وَتَجْعَلُونَ لَهُۥٓ أَندَادًۭا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ رَبُّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Say	“What!	You	disbelieve	in	Him	Who	created	the	earth	in	two	days,	and	you	appoint	equals	to	
Him?	He	is	the	Lord	Of	The	Creation!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāo	Kyā		tum	log	us	kā	inkār	rakhte	ho	jis	ne	do	din	meiñ	zamin	banāyi	aur	us	ke	hamsar	
thahrāte	ho	woh	hai	sāre	jahān	kā	Rab.

arabicText: وَجَعَلَ فِيهَا رَوَٰسِىَ مِن فَوْقِهَا وَبَـٰرَكَ فِيهَا وَقَدَّرَ فِيهَآ أَقْوَٰتَهَا فِىٓ أَرْبَعَةِ أَيَّامٍۢ سَوَآءًۭ لِّلسَّآئِلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	in	it	He	placed	mountains	as	anchors	from	above	it,	and	blessings	in	it,	and	appointed	the	
sustenance	for	those	who	dwell	in	it	-	all	this	in	four	days;	a	proper	answer	to	those	who	question.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	is	meiñ	is	ke	ūpar	se	langar	(bhāri	bojh)	dāle	aur	is	meiñ	barkat	rakhi	aur	is	meiñ	is	ke	basne	
wāloñ	ki	roziyāñ	muqarrar	kiñ	yeh	sab	milā	kar	chār	din	meiñ	thik	jawāb	poochne	wāloñ	ko.

arabicText: ثُمَّ ٱسْتَوَىٰٓ إِلَى ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَهِىَ دُخَانٌۭ فَقَالَ لَهَا وَلِلْأَرْضِ ٱئْتِيَا طَوْعًا أَوْ كَرْهًۭا قَالَتَآ أَتَيْنَا طَآئِعِينَ
englishTranslationText:
He	then	inclined	towards	the	heavens	and	it	was	smoke	-	thereupon	He	said	to	it	and	to	the	earth,	
“Both	of	you	present	yourselves,	willingly	or	with	reluctance”;	they	said,	“We	present	ourselves,	
with	zeal.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	āasmān	ki	ṭaraf	qasd	farmāyā	aur	woh	dhuwāñ	thā	to	us	se	aur	zamin	se	farmāyā	ke	donoñ	
ḥāzir	ho	khushi	se	chāhe	nā-khushi	se	donoñ	ne	árz	ki	ke	ham	raghbat	ke	sāth	ḥāzir	huye.

arabicText: فَقَضَىٰهُنَّ سَبْعَ سَمَـٰوَاتٍۢ فِى يَوْمَيْنِ وَأَوْحَىٰ فِى كُلِّ سَمَآءٍ أَمْرَهَا ۚ وَزَيَّنَّا ٱلسَّمَآءَ ٱلدُّنْيَا بِمَصَـٰبِيحَ وَحِفْظًۭا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ تَقْدِيرُ ٱلْعَزِيزِ ٱلْعَلِيمِ
englishTranslationText:
He	then	established	them	into	seven	
heavens	in	two	days,	and	to	each	heaven	
He	sent	the	command	of	its	affairs;	and	We	
decorated	the	lower	heaven	with	lamps;	
and	for	its	protection;	this	is	the	command	
set	by	the	Most	Honourable,	the	All	
Knowing.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	unheñ	poore	sāt	āasmān	kar	diyā	do	din	
meiñ	aur	har	āasmān	meiñ	usi	ke	kām	ke	
aḥkām	bheje	aur	ham	ne	neeche	ke	āasmān	
ko	charāghoñ	se	āarāsta	kiyā	aur	
nigahbāni	ke	liye	yeh	Us	Ízzat	wāle	Ílm	
wāle	kā	thahrāyā	huā	hai.

arabicText: فَإِنْ أَعْرَضُوا۟ فَقُلْ أَنذَرْتُكُمْ صَـٰعِقَةًۭ مِّثْلَ صَـٰعِقَةِ عَادٍۢ وَثَمُودَ
englishTranslationText:
Then	if	they	turn	away	say,	“I	warn	you	of	
a	thunderbolt	like	the	thunderbolt	which	
came	upon	A’ad	and	Thamud.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	agar	woh	moñh	phereñ	to	tum	farmāo	
ke	maiñ	tumheñ	darāta	hooñ	iak	kadak	se	
jaisi	kadak	'Āad	aur	Samood	par	āayi	thi.

arabicText: إِذْ جَآءَتْهُمُ ٱلرُّسُلُ مِنۢ بَيْنِ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمِنْ خَلْفِهِمْ أَلَّا تَعْبُدُوٓا۟ إِلَّا ٱللَّهَ ۖ قَالُوا۟ لَوْ شَآءَ رَبُّنَا لَأَنزَلَ مَلَـٰٓئِكَةًۭ فَإِنَّا بِمَآ أُرْسِلْتُم بِهِۦ كَـٰفِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
When	their	Noble	Messengers	approached	
them	from	front	and	from	behind	saying,	
"Do	not	worship	any	one	except	Allah";	
they	said,	"If	our	Lord	willed,	He	would	
surely	have	sent	down	angels	-	we	
therefore	deny	whatever	you	have	been	
sent	with.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jab	Rasool	un	ke	āage	piche	phirte	the	ke	
Allāh	ke	siwā	kisi	ko	na	poojo	bole	hamārā	
rab	chāhtā	to	farishte	utārtā	to	jo	kuchh	
tum	le	kar	bheje	gaye	ham	usey	nahiñ	
mānte.

arabicText: فَأَمَّا عَادٌۭ فَٱسْتَكْبَرُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ بِغَيْرِ ٱلْحَقِّ وَقَالُوا۟ مَنْ أَشَدُّ مِنَّا قُوَّةً ۖ أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَهُمْ هُوَ أَشَدُّ مِنْهُمْ قُوَّةًۭ ۖ وَكَانُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا يَجْحَدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	regarding	the	A’ad,	they	were	haughty	
in	the	land	without	right,	and	they	said,	
“Who	is	more	powerful	than	us?”	Did	they	
not	realise	that	Allah,	Who	created	them,	is	
more	powerful	than	them?	And	they	used	
to	deny	Our	signs.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	woh	jo	'Āad	the	unhoñ	ne	zamin	meiñ	
nāḥāq	takabbur	kiyā	aur	bole	ham	se	
ziyāda	kis	kā	zor	aur	kyā	unhoñ	ne	na	jānā	
ke	Allāh	jis	ne	unheñ	banāyā	un	se	zayāda	
qawi	hai	aur	hamāri	Āayatoñ	kā	inkār	
karte	the.

arabicText: فَأَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ رِيحًۭا صَرْصَرًۭا فِىٓ أَيَّامٍۢ نَّحِسَاتٍۢ لِّنُذِيقَهُمْ عَذَابَ ٱلْخِزْىِ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا ۖ وَلَعَذَابُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ أَخْزَىٰ ۖ وَهُمْ لَا يُنصَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
We	therefore	sent	a	violent	thunderstorm	
towards	them	in	their	days	of	misfortune,	
in	order	to	make	them	taste	a	disgraceful	punishment	in	the	life	of	this	world;	and	indeed	the	
punishment	of	the	Hereafter	is	more	disgracing,	and	they	will	not	be	helped.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	Ham	ne	un	par	aik	āañdhi	bheji	sakht	
garaj	ki	un	ki	shāmat	ke	dinoñ	meiñ	ke	ham	
unheñ	ruswāyi	kā	áƶāb	chakhāyeñ	duniyā	ki	zindagi	meiñ	aur	be-shak	āakhirat	ke	áƶāb	meiñ	sab	
se	badi	ruswāyi	hai	aur	un	ki	madad	na	hogi.

arabicText: وَأَمَّا ثَمُودُ فَهَدَيْنَـٰهُمْ فَٱسْتَحَبُّوا۟ ٱلْعَمَىٰ عَلَى ٱلْهُدَىٰ فَأَخَذَتْهُمْ صَـٰعِقَةُ ٱلْعَذَابِ ٱلْهُونِ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَكْسِبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	regarding	the	Thamud,	We	showed	them	the	right	path	-	so	they	chose	to	be	blind	above	
being	guided,	therefore	the	thunderbolt	of	the	disgraceful	punishment	overcame	them	-	the	
recompense	of	their	deeds.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	rahe	Samood	unheñ	ham	ne	rāh	dikhāyi	to	unhoñ	ne	soojhne	par	andhe	hone	ko	pasand	kiyā		
to	unheñ	ƶillat	ke	áƶāb	ki	kadak	ne	āa	liyā	sazā	un	ke	kiye	ki.

arabicText: وَنَجَّيْنَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَكَانُوا۟ يَتَّقُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	We	rescued	those	who	accepted	faith	and	were	pious.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	ham	ne	unheñ	bachā	liyā	jo	Imān	lāye	aur	darte	the.

arabicText: وَيَوْمَ يُحْشَرُ أَعْدَآءُ ٱللَّهِ إِلَى ٱلنَّارِ فَهُمْ يُوزَعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	on	the	day	when	the	enemies	of	Allah	are	herded	towards	the	fire,	the	earlier	groups	will	be	
restrained	till	the	latter	join	them.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jis	din	Allāh	ke	dushman	āag	ki	ṭaraf	hāñke	jāyeñ	ge	to	un	ke	agloñ	ko	rokeñ	ge.

arabicText: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا مَا جَآءُوهَا شَهِدَ عَلَيْهِمْ سَمْعُهُمْ وَأَبْصَـٰرُهُمْ وَجُلُودُهُم بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
To	the	extent	that	when	they	reach	it,	their	ears	and	their	eyes	and	their	skins	will	testify	against	
them	for	what	they	used	to	do.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yahāñ	tak	ke	pichle	āa	mileñ	yahāñ	tak	ke	jab	wahāñ	pahuñcheñ	ge	un	ke	kān	aur	un	ki	āankheñ	
aur	un	ke	chamde	sab	un	par	un	ke	kiye	ki	gawāhi	deñ	ge.

arabicText: وَقَالُوا۟ لِجُلُودِهِمْ لِمَ شَهِدتُّمْ عَلَيْنَا ۖ قَالُوٓا۟ أَنطَقَنَا ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَنطَقَ كُلَّ شَىْءٍۢ وَهُوَ خَلَقَكُمْ أَوَّلَ مَرَّةٍۢ وَإِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	they	will	say	to	their	skins,	“Why	did	
you	testify	against	us?";	they	will	say,	
“Allah	has	made	us	talk,	Who	has	given	all	
things	the	power	of	speech,	and	it	is	He	
Who	created	you	the	first	time,	and	it	is	to	
Him	that	you	have	to	return.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	apni	khāloñ	se	kaheñ	ge	tum	ne	
ham	par	kiyuñ	gawāhi	di	woh	kaheñ	gi	
hameñ	Allāh	ne	bulwāyā	jis	ne	har	cheez	ko	
goyāyi	bakhshi	aur	us	ne	tumheñ	pahli	bār	
banāyā	aur	usi	ki	ṭaraf	tumheñ	phirnā	hai.

arabicText: وَمَا كُنتُمْ تَسْتَتِرُونَ أَن يَشْهَدَ عَلَيْكُمْ سَمْعُكُمْ وَلَآ أَبْصَـٰرُكُمْ وَلَا جُلُودُكُمْ وَلَـٰكِن ظَنَنتُمْ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يَعْلَمُ كَثِيرًۭا مِّمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	where	could	you	hide	from	Him,	so	
that	your	ears	and	your	eyes	and	your	
skins	may	not	testify	against	you?	But	you	
had	assumed	that	Allah	does	not	know	
most	of	your	deeds!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tum	us	se	kahāñ	chip	kar	jāte	ke	tum	
par	gawāhi	deñ	tumhāre	kān	aur	tumhāri	
āankheñ	aur	tumhāri	khāleñ	lekin	tum	to	
yeh	samjhe	baithe	the	ke	Allāh	tumhāre	
bahut	se	kām	nahiñ	jāntā.

arabicText: وَذَٰلِكُمْ ظَنُّكُمُ ٱلَّذِى ظَنَنتُم بِرَبِّكُمْ أَرْدَىٰكُمْ فَأَصْبَحْتُم مِّنَ ٱلْخَـٰسِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	this	is	the	assumption	you	had	
regarding	your	Lord,	which	has	ruined	
you,	so	you	are	now	among	those	who	have	
been	defeated.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	yeh	hai	tumhārā	woh	gumān	jo	tum	ne	
apne	Rab	ke	sāth	kiyā	aur	us	ne	tumheñ	
halāk	kar	diyā	to	ab	rah	gaye	hāre	huoñ	
meiñ.

arabicText: فَإِن يَصْبِرُوا۟ فَٱلنَّارُ مَثْوًۭى لَّهُمْ ۖ وَإِن يَسْتَعْتِبُوا۟ فَمَا هُم مِّنَ ٱلْمُعْتَبِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Then	if	they	are	patient,	even	then	the	fire	
is	their	home;	and	if	they	plead,	none	will	
listen	to	their	pleading.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	agar	woh	sabr	kareñ	to	āag	un	kā	
thikānā	hai	aur	agar	woh	manānā	chāheiñ	
to	koyi	un	kā	manānā	na	māne.

arabicText: ۞ وَقَيَّضْنَا لَهُمْ قُرَنَآءَ فَزَيَّنُوا۟ لَهُم مَّا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ وَحَقَّ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلْقَوْلُ فِىٓ أُمَمٍۢ قَدْ خَلَتْ مِن قَبْلِهِم مِّنَ ٱلْجِنِّ وَٱلْإِنسِ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ خَـٰسِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	appointed	companions	for	them,	
who	made	what	is	before	them	and	what	is	
after	them	seem	good	to	them,	and	the	
Word	proved	true	upon	them	along	with	
the	groups	of	jinns	and	men	who	passed	
away	before	them;	they	were	indeed	
losers.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ham	ne	un	par	kuchh	sāthi	t’aiyyunāt	
kiye	unhoñ	ne	unheñ	bhalā	kar	dikhāyā	jo	
un	ke	āage	hai	aur	jo	un	ke	piche	aur	un	par	
bāt	pori	huyi	un	girohoñ	ke	sāth	jo	un	se	
pahle	guzar	chuke	jinn	aur	āadmiyoñ	ke	
be-shak	woh	ziyānkār	(nuqsān	meiñ)	the.

arabicText: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَا تَسْمَعُوا۟ لِهَـٰذَا ٱلْقُرْءَانِ وَٱلْغَوْا۟ فِيهِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَغْلِبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	disbelievers	said,	“Do	not	listen	to	
this	Qur’an	and	engulf	it	in	noise	-	perhaps	
you	may	be	victorious	this	way.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kāfir	bole	yeh	qurān	na	suno	aur	is	
meiñ	behooda	ghul	(shor)	karo	shāyad	yoñhi	tum	ghālib	āao.

arabicText: فَلَنُذِيقَنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ عَذَابًۭا شَدِيدًۭا وَلَنَجْزِيَنَّهُمْ أَسْوَأَ ٱلَّذِى كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	We	will	indeed	make	the	disbelievers	taste	the	severe	punishment,	and	indeed	We	will	repay	
them	for	their	worst	deeds.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	be-shak	zaroor	Ham	kāfiroñ	ko	sakht	áƶāb	chakhāyeñ	ge	aur	be-shak	ham	un	ke	bure	se	bure	
kām	kā	unheñ	badla	deñ	ge.

arabicText: ذَٰلِكَ جَزَآءُ أَعْدَآءِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلنَّارُ ۖ لَهُمْ فِيهَا دَارُ ٱلْخُلْدِ ۖ جَزَآءًۢ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا يَجْحَدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
This	is	the	recompense	of	Allah’s	enemies	-	the	fire;	they	have	to	stay	in	it	forever;	the	penalty	for	
denying	Our	signs.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	hai	Allāh	ke	dushmanoñ	kā	badla	āag	is	meiñ	unheñ	hamesha	rahnā	hai	sazā	is	ki	ke	hamāri	
Āayatoñ	kā	inkār	karte	the.

arabicText: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ رَبَّنَآ أَرِنَا ٱلَّذَيْنِ أَضَلَّانَا مِنَ ٱلْجِنِّ وَٱلْإِنسِ نَجْعَلْهُمَا تَحْتَ أَقْدَامِنَا لِيَكُونَا مِنَ ٱلْأَسْفَلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	disbelievers	said,	“Our	Lord!	Show	us	both	-	among	jinns	and	men	-	who	misled	us,	for	
us	to	put	them	beneath	our	feet	so	that	they	be	the	lowest	of	the	low.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kāfir	bole	aey	hamāre	Rab	hameñ	dikhā	woh	donoñ	Jinn	aur	Ādmi	jinhoñ	ne	hameñ	gumrāh	
kiyā	ke	ham	unheñ	apne	pāoñ	tale	dāleñ	ke	woh	har	neeche	se	neeche	raheñ.

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ قَالُوا۟ رَبُّنَا ٱللَّهُ ثُمَّ ٱسْتَقَـٰمُوا۟ تَتَنَزَّلُ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ أَلَّا تَخَافُوا۟ وَلَا تَحْزَنُوا۟ وَأَبْشِرُوا۟ بِٱلْجَنَّةِ ٱلَّتِى كُنتُمْ تُوعَدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	those	who	said,	“Allah	is	our	Lord”	
and	remained	firm	upon	it	–	upon	them	
descend	the	angels,	(saying),	“Do	not	fear	
nor	grieve,	and	be	happy	for	the	Paradise	
which	you	are	promised.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	woh	jinhoñ	ne	kahā	hamārā	Rab	
Allāh	hai	phir	us	par	qāim	rahe	un	par	
Farishte	utarte	haiñ	ke	na	daro	aur	na	
gham	karo	aur	khush	ho	us	Jannat	par	jis	
kā	tumheñ	w'ada	diyā	jātā	thā.

arabicText: نَحْنُ أَوْلِيَآؤُكُمْ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَفِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ ۖ وَلَكُمْ فِيهَا مَا تَشْتَهِىٓ أَنفُسُكُمْ وَلَكُمْ فِيهَا مَا تَدَّعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“We	are	your	friends	in	the	life	of	this	
world	and	in	the	Hereafter;	in	it	for	you	is	
all	that	you	may	wish	for,	and	in	it	for	you	
is	all	what	you	ask.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ham	tumhāre	dost	haiñ	duniyā	ki	zindagi	
meiñ	aur	āakhirat	meiñ	aur	tumhāre	liye	
hai	is	meiñ	jo	tumhārā	ji	chāhe	aur	
tumhāre	liye	is	meiñ	jo	mañgo.

arabicText: نَحْنُ أَوْلِيَآؤُكُمْ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَفِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ ۖ وَلَكُمْ فِيهَا مَا تَشْتَهِىٓ أَنفُسُكُمْ وَلَكُمْ فِيهَا مَا تَدَّعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“We	are	your	friends	in	the	life	of	this	
world	and	in	the	Hereafter;	in	it	for	you	is	
all	that	you	may	wish	for,	and	in	it	for	you	
is	all	what	you	ask.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ham	tumhāre	dost	haiñ	duniyā	ki	zindagi	
meiñ	aur	āakhirat	meiñ	aur	tumhāre	liye	
hai	is	meiñ	jo	tumhārā	ji	chāhe	aur	
tumhāre	liye	is	meiñ	jo	mañgo.

arabicText: نُزُلًۭا مِّنْ غَفُورٍۢ رَّحِيمٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
“The	hospitality	of	the	Oft	Forgiving,	Most	
Merciful.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Mehmāni	bakhsh	ne	wāle	maherbān		ki	
ṭaraf	se.

arabicText: وَمَنْ أَحْسَنُ قَوْلًۭا مِّمَّن دَعَآ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ وَعَمِلَ صَـٰلِحًۭا وَقَالَ إِنَّنِى مِنَ ٱلْمُسْلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	whose	speech	is	better	than	one	who	
calls	towards	his	Lord	and	does	righteous	
deeds,	and	says,	“I	am	a	Muslim.”?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	us	se	ziyāda	kis	ki	bāt	achchhi	jo	Allāh	
ki	ṭaraf	bulāye	aur	neki	kare	aur	kahe	maiñ	
Musalmān	hooñ.

arabicText: وَلَا تَسْتَوِى ٱلْحَسَنَةُ وَلَا ٱلسَّيِّئَةُ ۚ ٱدْفَعْ بِٱلَّتِى هِىَ أَحْسَنُ فَإِذَا ٱلَّذِى بَيْنَكَ وَبَيْنَهُۥ عَدَٰوَةٌۭ كَأَنَّهُۥ وَلِىٌّ حَمِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	good	deed	and	the	evil	deed	will	
never	be	equal;	O	listener!	Repel	the	evil	
deed	with	a	good	one,	thereupon	the	one	
between	whom	and	you	was	enmity,	will	
become	like	a	close	friend.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	neki	aur	badi	barābar	na	ho	jāyeñ	gi	
aey	sunne	wāle	burāyi	ko	bhlāyi	se	tāl	jabhi	
woh	ke	tujh	meiñ	aur	us	meiñ	dushmani	thi	aisā	ho	jāye	gā	jaisā	ke	gahrā	dost.

arabicText: وَمَا يُلَقَّىٰهَآ إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ صَبَرُوا۟ وَمَا يُلَقَّىٰهَآ إِلَّا ذُو حَظٍّ عَظِيمٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	none	receive	this	great	treasure	
except	those	who	are	patient;	and	none	
receives	this	except	one	who	is	extremely	
fortunate.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	yeh	doulat	nahiñ	milti	magar	sābiroñ	ko	aur	isey	nahiñ	pātā	magar	bade	naseeb	wālā.

arabicText: وَإِمَّا يَنزَغَنَّكَ مِنَ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنِ نَزْغٌۭ فَٱسْتَعِذْ بِٱللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
And	O	listener!	If	a	distracting	thought	
from	the	devil	reaches	you,	seek	the	refuge	of	Allah;	indeed	He	is	the	All	Hearing,	the	All	Knowing.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	tujhe	shiaṭān	kā	koyi	kaunchā	(wār)	pahuñche	to	Allāh	ki	panāh	māng	be-shak	wahi	
sunta	jāntā	hai.

arabicText: وَمِنْ ءَايَـٰتِهِ ٱلَّيْلُ وَٱلنَّهَارُ وَٱلشَّمْسُ وَٱلْقَمَرُ ۚ لَا تَسْجُدُوا۟ لِلشَّمْسِ وَلَا لِلْقَمَرِ وَٱسْجُدُوا۟ لِلَّهِ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَهُنَّ إِن كُنتُمْ إِيَّاهُ تَعْبُدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	night,	and	the	day,	and	the	sun,	and	the	moon	are	among	His	signs;	do	not	prostrate	for	
the	sun	or	the	moon,	but	prostrate	for	Allah	Who	has	created	them,	if	you	are	His	bondmen.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	us	ki	nishāniyoñ	meiñ	se	haiñ	rāt	aur	din	aur	sooraj	aur	chānd	sajda	na	karo	sooraj	ko	aur	na	
chānd	ko	aur	Allāh	ko	sajda	karo	jis	ne	unheñ	paidā	Kiyā		agar	tum	us	ke	bande	ho.

arabicText: فَإِنِ ٱسْتَكْبَرُوا۟ فَٱلَّذِينَ عِندَ رَبِّكَ يُسَبِّحُونَ لَهُۥ بِٱلَّيْلِ وَٱلنَّهَارِ وَهُمْ لَا يَسْـَٔمُونَ ۩
englishTranslationText:
So	if	these	(disbelievers)	be	haughty,	so	(in	any	case)	those	(the	angels)	who	are	with	your	Lord	
say	His	Purity	night	and	day,	and	they	do	not	get	weary.	(Command	of	Prostration	#	11)
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	agar	yeh	takabbur	kareñ	to	woh	jo	tumhāre	Rab	ke	pās	haiñ	rāt	din	us	ki	pāki	bolte	haiñ	aur	
uktāte	nahiñ.	(Sajde	ka	hukm	#11)

arabicText: وَمِنْ ءَايَـٰتِهِۦٓ أَنَّكَ تَرَى ٱلْأَرْضَ خَـٰشِعَةًۭ فَإِذَآ أَنزَلْنَا عَلَيْهَا ٱلْمَآءَ ٱهْتَزَّتْ وَرَبَتْ ۚ إِنَّ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَحْيَاهَا لَمُحْىِ ٱلْمَوْتَىٰٓ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ قَدِيرٌ
englishTranslationText:
And	among	His	signs	is	that	you	see	the	
earth	lying	neglected,	so	when	We	sent	
down	water	on	it,	it	freshened	up	and	grew	
forth;	indeed	He	Who	gave	it	life,	will	
revive	the	dead;	indeed	He	is	Able	to	do	all	
things.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	us	ki	nishāniyoñ	se	hai	ke	tu	zamin	ko	
dekhe	be-qadr	padi	phir	ham	ne	jab	us	par	
pāni	utārā	tar-o-tāza	huyi	aur	badh	chali	
be-shak	jis	ne	usey	jilāyā	zaroor		murde	
jilāye	(zinda	kare)	gā	be-shak	woh	sab	
kuchh	kar	saktā	hai.

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يُلْحِدُونَ فِىٓ ءَايَـٰتِنَا لَا يَخْفَوْنَ عَلَيْنَآ ۗ أَفَمَن يُلْقَىٰ فِى ٱلنَّارِ خَيْرٌ أَم مَّن يَأْتِىٓ ءَامِنًۭا يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ ۚ ٱعْمَلُوا۟ مَا شِئْتُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ بَصِيرٌ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	those	who	distort	Our	verses	are	
not	hidden	from	Us;	so	is	one	who	is	cast	
into	the	fire	better,	or	one	who	comes	in	
safety	on	the	Day	of	Resurrection?	Do	
whatever	you	wish!	He	is	indeed	seeing	
your	deeds.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	woh	jo	Hamāri	Āayatoñ	meiñ	
tedhe	chalte	haiñ	ham	se	chupe	nahiñ	to	
Kyā		jo	āag	meiñ	dālā	jāye	gā	woh	bhalā	yā	
jo	Qiyāmat	meiñ	amān	se	āaye	gā	jo	ji	meiñ	
āaye	karo	be-shak	woh	tumhāre	kām	dekh	
rahā	hai.

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِٱلذِّكْرِ لَمَّا جَآءَهُمْ ۖ وَإِنَّهُۥ لَكِتَـٰبٌ عَزِيزٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	those	who	denied	the	
Remembrance	when	it	came	to	them	-	they	
are	truly	ruined;	and	indeed	it	is	an	
honourable	Book.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	jo	ƶikr	se	munkir	huye	jab	woh	un	
ke	pās	āayā	un	ki	kharābi	kā	kuchh	ḥāl	na	
poochh	aur	be-shak	woh	'izzat	wāli	Kitāb	
hai.

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِٱلذِّكْرِ لَمَّا جَآءَهُمْ ۖ وَإِنَّهُۥ لَكِتَـٰبٌ عَزِيزٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	those	who	denied	the	
Remembrance	when	it	came	to	them	-	they	
are	truly	ruined;	and	indeed	it	is	an	
honourable	Book.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	jo	ƶikr	se	munkir	huye	jab	woh	un	
ke	pās	āayā	un	ki	kharābi	kā	kuchh	ḥāl	na	
poochh	aur	be-shak	woh	'izzat	wāli	Kitāb	
hai.

arabicText: لَّا يَأْتِيهِ ٱلْبَـٰطِلُ مِنۢ بَيْنِ يَدَيْهِ وَلَا مِنْ خَلْفِهِۦ ۖ تَنزِيلٌۭ مِّنْ حَكِيمٍ حَمِيدٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Falsehood	cannot	approach	it	-	neither	
from	its	front	nor	from	its	back;	it	is	sent	
down	by	the	Wise,	the	Most	Praiseworthy.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bāṭil	ko	us	ki	ṭaraf	rāh	nahiñ	na	us	ke	āage	
se	na	us	ke	piche	se	utārā	huā	hai	ḥikmat	
wāle	sab	khoobiyoñ	sarāhe	kā.

arabicText: مَّا يُقَالُ لَكَ إِلَّا مَا قَدْ قِيلَ لِلرُّسُلِ مِن قَبْلِكَ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَذُو مَغْفِرَةٍۢ وَذُو عِقَابٍ أَلِيمٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
You	will	not	be	told	except	what	was	said	
to	the	Noble	Messengers	before	you;	that	
“Your	Lord	is	the	Owner	of	Forgiveness,	
and	the	Owner	of	Painful	Punishment.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	se	na	farmāyā	jāye	gā	magar	wohi	jo	
tum	se	agle	Rasooloñ	ko	farmāyā	gayā	ke	
be-shak	tumhārā	Rab	bakhshish	wālā	aur	
dard-nāk	áƶāb	wālā	hai.

arabicText: وَلَوْ جَعَلْنَـٰهُ قُرْءَانًا أَعْجَمِيًّۭا لَّقَالُوا۟ لَوْلَا فُصِّلَتْ ءَايَـٰتُهُۥٓ ۖ ءَا۬عْجَمِىٌّۭ وَعَرَبِىٌّۭ ۗ قُلْ هُوَ لِلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ هُدًۭى وَشِفَآءٌۭ ۖ وَٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ فِىٓ ءَاذَانِهِمْ وَقْرٌۭ وَهُوَ عَلَيْهِمْ عَمًى ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ يُنَادَوْنَ مِن مَّكَانٍۭ بَعِيدٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	if	We	had	made	it	as	a	Qur’an	in	a	
foreign	language	they	would	have	
certainly	said,	“Why	were	its	verses	not	
explained	in	detail?”	What!	The	Book	in	a	
foreign	language,	and	the	Prophet	an	Arab?!	Proclaim	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	-	peace	and	
blessings	be	upon	him),	“It	is	a	guidance	and	a	cure	for	the	believers”;	and	there	is	deafness	in	the	
ears	of	those	who	do	not	believe,	and	it	is	blindness	upon	them;	as	if	they	are	being	called	from	a	
place	far	away!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	ham	usey	Àjmi	zubān	kā	Qur’ān	karte	to	zaroor	kahte	ke	us	ki	āayateñ	kiyuñ	na	kholi	
gayiñ	kyā	kitāb	Àjmi	aur	Nabi	Arabi	tum	farmāo	woh	Imān	wāloñ	ke	liye	hidāyat	aur	shifā	hai	aur	
woh	jo	Imān	nahiñ	lāte	un	ke	kānoñ	meiñ	tent	(ruyi)	hai	aur	woh	un	par	andhā	pan	hai	goyā	woh	
door	jagah	se	pukāre	jāte	haiñ.

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَا مُوسَى ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ فَٱخْتُلِفَ فِيهِ ۗ وَلَوْلَا كَلِمَةٌۭ سَبَقَتْ مِن رَّبِّكَ لَقُضِىَ بَيْنَهُمْ ۚ وَإِنَّهُمْ لَفِى شَكٍّۢ مِّنْهُ مُرِيبٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	indeed	gave	the	Book	to	Moosa,	so	a	dispute	was	created	regarding	it;	and	were	it	not	
for	a	Word	that	had	already	gone	forth	from	your	Lord,	the	judgement	would	have	been	
immediately	passed	upon	them;	and	indeed	they	are	in	an	intriguing	doubt	regarding	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	ham	ne	Mūsā	ko	Kitāb	áṭā	farmāyi	to	us	meiñ	ikhtilāf	kiyā	gayā	aur	agar	aik	bāt	
tumhāre	Rab	ki	ṭaraf	se	guzar	na	chuki	hoti	to	jabhi	un	kā	faisla	ho	jātā	aur	be-shak	woh	zaroor		
us	ki	ṭaraf	se	aik	dhoka	dālne	wāle	shak	meiñ	haiñ.

arabicText: مَّنْ عَمِلَ صَـٰلِحًۭا فَلِنَفْسِهِۦ ۖ وَمَنْ أَسَآءَ فَعَلَيْهَا ۗ وَمَا رَبُّكَ بِظَلَّـٰمٍۢ لِّلْعَبِيدِ
englishTranslationText:
Whoever	does	good	deeds,	so	it	is	for	his	own	good,	and	whoever	commits	evil,	so	it	is	for	his	own	
harm;	and	your	Lord	does	not	at	all	oppress	the	bondmen.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jo	neki	kare	woh	apne	bhale	ko	aur	jo	burāyi	kare	to	apne	bure	ko	aur	tumhārā	Rab	bandoñ	par	
zulm	nahiñ	kartā.
